settings.custom_text_title: 5 Safety Tips for Men and Women New to Having Anal Sex
settings.custom_text_body:
1. If it’s not a “hell yes”, then it’s a no. Like everything in life, especially sex, if the idea of anal sex doesn’t doesn’t bring out an enthusiastic yes, then you probably shouldn’t do it.
  2. Don't feel pressured - Remember, you're in control. Don't feel pressured to do anything you're not comfortable with, and don't be afraid to speak up.
  3. Talk it out - Communication is key! Make sure you and your partner have an open and honest conversation about what you both want and expect from the experience. Don't be shy, speak up!
  4. Always use a condom. The interior of the anus is an area that can easily become infected if there are any small fissures or wounds. A condom will help prevent any diseases, such as HIV and HPV, and will allow you to enjoy the experience while staying safe.
  5. Lube it up! The anus isn’t self lubricating like the vagina, so make sure to use plenty of lube to avoid any discomfort or pain. Seriously, you can never have too much lube.
